title: Growing Through Conflict
description: Explore how conflict can become an opportunity for deeper connection.

questions.text: I believe conflict in relationships can...
choices: Deepen understanding if handled well
Reveal important things about each other
Strengthen the bond when navigated together
All of theseâ€”conflict has potential

therapeutic.rationale: Seeing conflict's potential enables growth. Deeper-understanding seekers learn through conflict; revealer-types gain insight; bond-strengtheners connect through challenges. This perspective transforms conflict from threat to opportunity.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these potentials are real. Conflict managed well provides all of them.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared belief in conflict's potential creates aligned approach to disagreements.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What good has come from conflict in your relationship? What made that possible?

questions.text: What I've learned about myself through conflict is...
choices: My triggers and where they come from
How I handle stress and emotion
What I need to feel safe and heard
Areas where I want to grow

therapeutic.rationale: Conflict teaches self-knowledge. Trigger-learners understand their history; stress-handlers know their patterns; need-identifiers know their requirements; growth-area seers know their edges. This self-awareness enables better conflict.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different learnings are all valuable. Share what you've learned about yourself.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared self-learning focus creates mutual growth through conflict.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What has conflict taught you about yourself? Has that knowledge helped?

questions.text: What I've learned about my partner through conflict is...
choices: What they need when they're upset
Their sensitivities and vulnerabilities
How much they care about us
How we're different and why

therapeutic.rationale: Conflict reveals partners. Need-learners know how to support; sensitivity-learners know what to protect; care-seers recognize investment; difference-understanders know the gaps. This knowledge deepens intimacy.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different learnings are all valuable. Share what you've learned about each other.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared partner learning creates mutual understanding gained through conflict.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What has conflict taught you about your partner? How has that helped?

questions.text: The conflict skill I most want to develop is...
choices: Staying calm when I'm triggered
Listening better when I'm upset
Expressing myself without attacking
Repairing more quickly after conflict

therapeutic.rationale: Growth areas in conflict are personal. Calm-stayers work on regulation; better-listeners work on attention; non-attackers work on expression; quick-repairers work on reconnection. Naming your edge enables focused development.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different skill goals reflect different growth edges. Support each other's development.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared skill focus creates aligned growth work.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What conflict skill do you most want to develop? What would help you grow?

questions.text: My hope for how we handle conflict going forward is...
choices: That we keep getting better at it together
That conflict brings us closer instead of apart
That we feel safe even when we disagree
That we see each conflict as a chance to understand each other more

therapeutic.rationale: Future conflict visions guide development. Improvement-hopers see trajectory; closeness-hopers see connection; safety-hopers see security; understanding-hopers see learning. Shared vision aligns your conflict growth.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these hopes support healthy conflict. You can achieve all of them.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared vision creates aligned goals for your conflict future.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you hope for in how you handle conflict going forward?
